ivardefs.name: calibration_
ivardefs.desc: Describes the calibrations that have been performed or that are required to be performed.

ivardefs.name: category
ivardefs.desc: Indicates the category of the observation generation process. A DeviceMetric can be for example a setting, measurement, or calculation.

ivardefs.name: color
ivardefs.desc: Describes the color representation for the metric. This is often used to aid clinicians to track and identify parameter types by color. In practice, consider a Patient Monitor that has ECG/HR and Pleth for example; the parameters are displayed in differen

ivardefs.name: identifier_
ivardefs.desc: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a device by the device or gateway software, manufacturers, other organizations or owners. For example: handle ID.

ivardefs.name: measurementPeriod
ivardefs.desc: Describes the measurement repetition time. This is not necessarily the same as the update period. The measurement repetition time can range from milliseconds up to hours. An example for a measurement repetition time in the range of milliseconds is the sam

ivardefs.name: operationalStatus
ivardefs.desc: Indicates current operational state of the device. For example: On, Off, Standby, etc.

ivardefs.name: parent
ivardefs.desc: Describes the link to the  Device that this DeviceMetric belongs to and that provide information about the location of this DeviceMetric in the containment structure of the parent Device. An example would be a Device that represents a Channel. This refere

ivardefs.name: source
ivardefs.desc: Describes the link to the  Device that this DeviceMetric belongs to and that contains administrative device information such as manufacturer, serial number, etc.

ivardefs.name: type
ivardefs.desc: Describes the type of the metric. For example: Heart Rate, PEEP Setting, etc.

ivardefs.name: unit
ivardefs.desc: Describes the unit that an observed value determined for this metric will have. For example: Percent, Seconds, etc.

properties.desc: Describes a measurement, calculation or setting capability of a medical device.
